item.title: [PI]Freeze![PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

In PlayerAssistant.java, I added:

public void frozenAdmin() { if(Misc.random(o.getCombat().mageDef()) > Misc.random(mageAtk())) { c.magicFailed = true; } else { c.magicFailed = false; } int freezeDelay = getFreezeTime();//freeze time if(freezeDelay > 0 && Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer <= -3 && !c.magicFailed) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer = freezeDelay; o.resetWalkingQueue(); o.sendMessage("You have been frozen."); o.frozenBy = c.playerId; } if (!c.autocasting && c.spellId <= 0) c.playerIndex = 0; }

In Commands.java, I added:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("freeze") && c.playerRights >= 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; public void frozenAdmin(); c.sendMessage("You froze " + c2.playerName + "!"); c2.sendMessage("You have been frozen by an admin!!"); c2.startgfx(370); //barrage gfx } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

When compiling, I got these errors:

\Commands.java:90:90: illegal start of expression public void frozenAdmin(); ^

\Commands.java:90:90:illegal start of expression public void frozenAdmin(); ^

\Commands.java:90:90: ';' expected public void frozenAdmin(); ^

With your codes, I got about 65 errors >.>

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Freeze![PI]
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

I’m not completely sure but…

try making a void containing

if(Misc.random(o.getCombat().mageDef()) > Misc.random(mageAtk())) { c.magicFailed = true; } else { c.magicFailed = false; } int freezeDelay = getFreezeTime();//freeze time if(freezeDelay > 0 && Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer <= -3 && !c.magicFailed) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer = freezeDelay; o.resetWalkingQueue(); o.sendMessage("You have been frozen."); o.frozenBy = c.playerId; } if (!c.autocasting && c.spellId <= 0) c.playerIndex = 0; }

and calling it in

if (playerCommand.startsWith("freeze") && c.playerRights >= 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; [b](HOW TO FREEZE THEM HERE)[/b] c.sendMessage("You froze " + c2.playerName + "!"); c2.sendMessage("You have been frozen by an admin!!"); c2.startgfx(370); //barrage gfx } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

[hr]

In other words add this somewhere…

public void freezeTarget() { if(Misc.random(o.getCombat().mageDef()) > Misc.random(mageAtk())) { c.magicFailed = true; } else { c.magicFailed = false; } int freezeDelay = getFreezeTime();//freeze time if(freezeDelay > 0 && Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer <= -3 && !c.magicFailed) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer = freezeDelay; o.resetWalkingQueue(); o.sendMessage("You have been frozen."); o.frozenBy = c.playerId; } if (!c.autocasting && c.spellId <= 0) c.playerIndex = 0; } }

and change the command to

if (playerCommand.startsWith("freeze") && c.playerRights >= 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; freezeTarget(); c.sendMessage("You froze " + c2.playerName + "!"); //Quoted since freezeTarget states frozen status c2.sendMessage("You have been frozen by an admin!!"); c2.startgfx(370); //barrage gfx } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

[hr]

I’m assuming all of the code you provided was correct

item.title: [PI]Freeze![PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

I am trying to make a command that when done to a player, they are frozen.

Example: ::freeze (playernamehere)

But I do not know how to make them be frozen…

I found ice method:

if(Misc.random(o.getCombat().mageDef()) > Misc.random(mageAtk())) { c.magicFailed = true; } else { c.magicFailed = false; } int freezeDelay = getFreezeTime();//freeze time if(freezeDelay > 0 && Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer <= -3 && !c.magicFailed) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].freezeTimer = freezeDelay; o.resetWalkingQueue(); o.sendMessage("You have been frozen."); o.frozenBy = c.playerId; } if (!c.autocasting && c.spellId <= 0) c.playerIndex = 0; }

This is how the code I want should look (Basically):

if (playerCommand.startsWith("freeze") && c.playerRights >= 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; (HOW TO FREEZE THEM HERE) c.sendMessage("You froze " + c2.playerName + "!"); c2.sendMessage("You have been frozen by an admin!!"); c2.startgfx(370); //barrage gfx } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Help?

Read full topic
